item.title: Norton Fitzwarren's lost chapel?
item.description: What was the chapel of St Mary the Virgin in the cemetery of Norton Fitzwarren? Was it a lost chapel or the parish church?
item.dc:creator: MaryS

item.title: Norton Fitzwarren's lost chapel?
item.description: What was the chapel of St Mary the Virgin in the cemetery of Norton Fitzwarren? Was it a lost chapel or the parish church?
item.dc:creator: MaryS

item.title: Norton Fitzwarren's public houses
item.description: For a small parish Norton Fitzwarren had several public houses, partly owing to the fact that two main roads crossed the parish.
item.dc:creator: MaryS

item.title: Morse's House, Norton Fitwarren
item.description: This former farmhouse and later factory office was one of the oldest domestic buildings in Norton Fitwarren but was demolished.
item.dc:creator: MaryS

item.title: Norton Fitzwarren National School
item.description: Norton Fitwarren had a succession of school premises but the 1872 National School was in use for over a century.
item.dc:creator: MaryS

item.title: Norton Fitzwarren in the Second World War
item.description: Norton Fitzwarren was an important military site in the Second World War which left aÂ  lasting legacy to the parish.
item.dc:creator: MaryS

item.title: Norton Fitwarren War memorial
item.description: Norton Fitwarren has an unusual war memorial in the form of the gate pillars outside the village club house, now the village hall.
item.dc:creator: MaryS

item.title: The Military History of Norton Fitzwarren
item.description: Norton Fitzwarren on the outskirts of Taunton was a site of national importance during the Second World War with several miltary sites
item.dc:creator: MaryS
